title: Chipmunk

verbs: To speed up an audio recording, especially a song, to make the voices high-pitched.
nouns: A burrowing ground squirrel of western America and Asia; has cheek pouches and a light and dark stripe running down the body
A squirrel-like rodent of the genus Tamias, native mainly to North America.
Chipmunks are small, striped rodents of the family Sciuridae.
Striped rodent of the squirrel family known as Timber Tigers
Any squirrel of the genus Tamias.
Large number of species of small or medium-sized rodentos  of the family Sciuridae
Squirrels are members of the family Sciuridae, consisting of small or medium-size rodents.
A small or medium-sized rodent of the family Sciuridae.
A kind of arboreal rodent having a long bushy tail
Any of the rodents of the family Sciuridae distinguished by their large bushy tail.
Relatively small placental mammals having a single pair of constantly growing incisor teeth specialized for gnawing
Rodents are mammals of the order Rodentia, characterized by a single pair of continuously growing incisors in each of the upper and lower jaws.
Any of the relatively small placental mammals that constitute the order Rodentia, having constantly growing incisor teeth specialized for gnawing.
A mammal of the order Rodentia, characterized by long incisors that grow continuously and are worn down by gnawing.

description:
A chipmunk, a small rodent with puffy cheeks. Depicted as a brown chipmunk in full profile facing left, sitting on its hind legs with a bushy tail and striped body. Generally holding an acorn or other nut in its hands.

May be used to represent a squirrel or related animals.

At one point, Google’s chipmunk was looking forward, squinting with a buck tooth. Microsoft’s previous black-and-white design could be mistaken for a skunk.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's chipmunk emoji is a delightful and charming rendering, featuring a plump, furry creature with distinct stripes along its back, all brought to life with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading and realistic lighting. Its bright, curious eyes and subtly parted mouth, combined with soft, rounded edges on its fur and tail, give it an approachable and animated personality. This emoji is often used to represent nature, small animals, or a sense of playful alertness, adding a touch of woodland charm to messages on Apple devices.
